question.title: Vertx difference between onComplete and onSuccess
question.body:
Whats the difference between using onComplete and onSuccess. Will onComplete will wait for all futures to complete and then execute

CompositeFuture.join(results)
.onComplete(
    ar -> {
      if (ar.succeeded()) {
        List<JsonObject> queryResponses = new ArrayList<>();
        results.forEach(
            ft -> {
              if (ft.succeeded()) {
                queryResponses.addAll((List<JsonObject>) ft.result());
              }
            });
      } else {
        responsePromise.fail(ar.cause());
      }
    })
.onFailure(responsePromise::fail);

and

CompositeFuture.join(results)
    .onSuccess(
        ar -> {
          List<JsonObject> queryResponses = new ArrayList<>();
          results.forEach(
              ft -> {
              if (ft.success()) {
                queryResponses.addAll((List<JsonObject>) ft.result());
                } else {
                queryResponses.add(Collections.emptyList());
                }
              });
          responsePromise.complete(queryResponses);
        })
    .onFailure(responsePromise::fail);
return responsePromise.future();
